intro: Stachytarpheta discolor, commonly known as the purpletop plant, is a member of the Verbenaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive two-toned flowers, which feature a purple upper lip and a white lower lip. Native to the tropical regions of the Americas, it thrives in warm, humid climates. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
